title: Who are some of the worst CEOs of all time? - Quora

response.answer_text: This article cites an old Conde Nast Portfolio survey of the worst CEOs ever, but it’s dated in 2013 (I think the original survey was completed in 2009 … but I don’t have supporting facts) … Citi’s Pandit among 20 worst CEOs; Ford is best-ever: Survey The article above lists: Dick Fuld - Lehman Brothers (already mentioned in the answers)Vikram Pandit - CitigroupMartin Sullivan - AIGKen Lay - EnronBernie Ebbers - WorldComAngelo Mozilo - Countrywide FinancialJimmy Cayne - Bear Sterns

Stephen Elop. He’s the guy who destroyed Nokia. Yes Nokia, that once was a biggest mobile phone manufacturer. In result of Stephen Elop, Nokia lost their mobile phone business completely and was sold for pennies to Microsoft. Many say that he was secretly working for Microsoft and his only job was to destroy Nokia and later convince the board to accept Microsoft’s proposal. No matter what you belief he’s one of the worst CEOs of all time as he completely destroyed a great company.
